subtitle: Fennel has a slightly aniseed  flavour that works well with fish but if you don't like the flavour, simply leave it out.

method.text: Wash and dry trout inside and out. Use a sharp knife to cut several slashes on each side. Mix together thyme leaves, oil and seasoning. Rub over fish, making sure flavourings are pressed well into slashes. Marinate for at least 1 hour.

Meanwhile, make the butter. Toast fennel seeds in a dry frying pan until golden and they release aniseed aroma. Cool slightly and grind to a fine powder in a spice mill or pestle and mortar. Beat into butter with parsley, lemon juice and some pepper. Chill until required.

Brush fish with a little extra oil and cook on a hot barbecue for 3-4 min each side until charred and cooked through. Rest for 5 min. Serve with the fennel butter. (Alternatively you could cook the fish under a preheated hot grill.)

title: Barbecued trout with fennel butter
